title: 107_hr1623
content: The Act is titled the "Historically Women's Public Colleges or Universities Historic Building Restoration and Preservation Act." It defines historically women's public colleges or universities and historic buildings or structures. The Secretary of the Interior is referred to as the Secretary. The Act provides grants for the preservation and restoration of historic buildings and structures at historically women's public colleges or universities. The Secretary awards grants to historically women's public colleges or universities for preserving and restoring historic buildings. Grants are funded through the National Historic Preservation Act for fiscal years 2002-2006. Grantees must agree to conditions such as obtaining Secretary's approval for alterations and allowing public access for educational purposes. Matching requirements apply to buildings listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The Secretary may obligate funds for grants related to historic buildings listed on the National Register of Historic Places, with a requirement for the grantee to provide 50% of the program costs from non-Federal sources. In-kind contributions are also accepted in addition to cash payments. The program funded under the grant requires 50% of costs to be covered by non-Federal sources, with the Secretary providing the remaining 50%. In-kind contributions of property or personnel services can be used for the non-Federal share of costs. Not more than $16,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2002 to 2006 may be available under this section, with specific allocations for grants to Mississippi University for Women and Georgia College and State University in fiscal year 2002. In fiscal year 2002, grants under subsection (a) will allocate $2,000,000 each to various universities including Mississippi University for Women, Georgia College and State University, University of North Carolina, Winthrop University, University of Montevallo, Texas Woman's University, University of Science and Arts of Oklahoma, and Wesleyan College. If less than $16,000,000 is available, the amount will be adjusted accordingly. If less than $16,000,000 is available, the amount will be adjusted accordingly. Funds for fiscal years 2003-2006 will be distributed to eligible grantees on a uniform basis. The Secretary will promulgate necessary regulations to carry out this Act.
